headline: Morning Movers: Tesla, IBM slipping following quarterly reports
summary: Stock futures were modestly lower as disappointing quarterly results from major tech names weighed on sentiment. Markets look set to open with a muted tone, reflecting a mix of elevated risk and uncertainty. Oil surged nearly 4% after the U.S. imposed fresh sanctions on Russia’s top oil companies, creating a shockwave across energy markets and raising inflation concerns. Concurrently, the dollar firmed against major currencies ahead of a delayed U.S. consumer-price report, while the yen weakened

headline: United States Water Purifier Market Report 2025-2033: Technology, Distribution Channel, End User, Key States and Company Analysis
summary: The United States water purifier market is poised for significant growth, projected to expand from $17.30 billion in 2024 to $29.73 billion by 2033, at a CAGR of 6.20%. Key drivers include heightened awareness of water quality, health issues, and technological innovations. Increasing concerns about pollutants like PFAS and lead propel demand for reliable purification solutions. headline: Honeywell sees sales growth despite market turmoil
summary: The industrial conglomerate is focused on 2026, when it will finalize a split into three companies, including an automation pure-play involving its building and industrial service offerings.

raw.headline: Honeywell sees sales growth despite market turmoil

headline: HON Q3 Deep Dive: Portfolio Realignment, Strong Orders, Margin Pressures Shape Outlook
summary: Industrial conglomerate Honeywell (NASDAQ:HON) reported revenue ahead of Wall Street’s expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 7% year on year to $10.41 billion. The company expects the full year’s revenue to be around $40.8 billion, close to analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.82 per share was 9.9% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: 2 Large-Cap Stocks with Competitive Advantages and 1 We Brush Off
summary: Large-cap stocks have the power to shape entire industries thanks to their size and widespread influence. With such vast footprints, however, finding new areas for growth is much harder than for smaller, more agile players.

raw.headline: 2 Large-Cap Stocks with Competitive Advantages and 1 We Brush Off

headline: Honeywell (HON): Net Profit Margin Falls to 14.3%, Underscoring Market Growth Lag
summary: Honeywell International (HON) delivered steady earnings, with profits rising 3.7% per year over the last five years and net profit margins currently at 14.3%, which is a dip from last year’s 15.5%. Despite negative earnings growth last year and revenue forecasted to grow at 4.4% per year, the company is expected to see earnings increase at a 7.41% annual pace. This trails the broader US market’s 10% benchmark. These results frame a narrative of incremental progress, but investors will be...
